references.paper_title: Predicting positive and negative links in online social networks
references.reason: This foundational paper introduced the problem of link sign prediction in online social networks, which is the central problem addressed in the current paper.
This paper provides a comprehensive survey of signed network mining in social media, which is relevant background for understanding the challenges and opportunities in signed graph neural networks.

references.paper_title: Semi-supervised classification with graph convolutional networks
references.reason: This seminal work introduced graph convolutional networks (GCNs), which are the foundation for many of the signed graph neural network (SGNN) models discussed in the paper.
This work introduced Signed Graph Convolutional Networks (SGCNs), a specific type of SGNN that is directly relevant to the work in the paper and used as a baseline model.

references.paper_title: Signed graph neural network with latent groups
references.reason: This paper proposes a novel SGNN model that incorporates latent group information, which addresses a key challenge related to unbalanced triangles, an issue also addressed in the current paper.
